TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1026
TEI.2.document_title: George Huff to Stephen F. Austin, 01-29-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: George Huff to Austin, January 29, 1825. Emigration from Mississippi. Land. Mills.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1026

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*George Huff to Austin, January 29, 1825. Emigration from Mississippi. Land. Mills.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"* *p**location_mentioned*Woodville*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="01-29-1825">January 29th 1825*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*My Dr Sir*/p*
*p*this will Be Handed to yoo By *person_mentioned*Jacob Huff*/person_mentioned* My *person_mentioned*Son */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Peter Conrad*/person_mentioned* with him I wish them to stay with yoo ontil I get there I Shall start from this Place in *date_mentioned n="02-08-1825">ten days*/date_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Mr. Brooks*/person_mentioned* who is with the Boyes is a Good and Honest Man I wish yoo to Settle him as Near the *location_mentioned*Mill Seat*/location_mentioned* as you Can I wish yoo to furnish Him with tools to git me a set of House Logs *location_mentioned*on the Bernard */location_mentioned* ontil I Git there as I Must attend to the Building of the *location_mentioned*Mills */location_mentioned*I Shall Be there with A strong force and good work *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*I think to Have them in oparation in *date_mentioned n="08-xx-1825">August*/date_mentioned* Next or I Shall Lose My Judgement of *location_mentioned*Mill*/location_mentioned* Building I think I will not Make Such a Hand of it as *person_mentioned*[Mr.] Toung*/person_mentioned* did I wish you to show the *location_mentioned*Cane Brake*/location_mentioned* . . . [on] *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*John Huff*/person_mentioned*s League*/location_mentioned* to *person_mentioned*Mr. Brooks*/person_mentioned* as he will make [a crop next?] year *person_mentioned*Mr Jesse H Cartright*/person_mentioned* will ... he takes About fifty *person_mentioned*negros*/person_mentioned* ... to Have Land as he goes on My word I wish you to Let him Have a Good League of Land for he is as good A Man as we have in this *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned* I wish you to Procure Me two yok of well Broke oxen and About 80 Bushels of Corn for I Shall want them things as Soon as I Git there all the things you Sent for By Me will Be there in Due time *person_mentioned*Mr Halleman*/person_mentioned* dont go this *date_mentioned n="Spring - 1825">spring */date_mentioned*as you saw through him I Shall say nothing About him ontil I see you I have A Great Deal to write But as it will Be But A few days ontil I See you I Shall stop*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Geo Huff*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col S f Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
